channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Braham Street LONDON E1 8EE, 9th January
item.description:
The memorial for TFL employees who were victims of Covid is surrounded by dumped litter, cans, bottles and plastic. Very sad that a memorial should be in such a mess. What if relatives wanted to visit? No cleaning donethere for months.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep Pothole in Middle of Road, 9th January
item.description:
There is a very deep round hole forming in the centre of Charlton Road. This hole is deep enough to cause severe damage to vehicles if it is hit and needs to be fixed ASAP
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Charlton Road, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Random bin near Waitrose, 9th January
item.description:
This was reported before and the ticket was closed. The bin is still in place with a shopping basket of rubbish next to it. Who does this bin belong to and why is rubbish left next to it on a daily basis that does not appear to be removed. The bin needs to be removed and replaced back to either Waitrose or the Travelodge bin area. Please can this be actioned.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Albany Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light not working, 9th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Regency Way, Blendon, Greater London

item.title: Pathway flooded again, 9th January
item.description:
The path has flooded again in the subway. This is the only safe route to a number of local schools (without crossing a main road) for young children. This keeps happening every time it rains. As well as unblocking it in the first instance, please can the drains be fixed so that this doesnâ€™t reoccur every time it rains. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crossway, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Building/Construction Waste Materials Fly tipped or left in the street. Needs removing, 9th January
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Piedmont Road, Plumstead
